abstract.para: DocBook is based on XML so you can use all XML tools―be it commercial or open source. As long as they behave standard conform, they will produce the same results.
This chapter deals with how to setup open source tools for the DocBook workflow.

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Tools for DocBook falls in one of the following category:

listitem.para: These tools were used to validate your XML source. DocBook can be validated through DTD, RELAX NG, or W3C schema. Some validators support only DTD, other more.

Needed to write your DocBook XML source. Basically, you can use whatever editor you like as XML is just text. However, entering your structure and text is more convenient with an XML editor. It gives you a context sensitive hint what is allowed and what not. Some gives you even a tooltip and shows a short explanation of the element.
Currently, there are XSLT processors for XSLT1, XSLT2, and XSLT3. For XSLT2 and XSLT3 there is only Saxon 9 available.
